physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman, wearing a draped cloth on her head, harvesting some plants. She is carrying a basket of plucked shrubs on her back. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of woman harvesting crops
subject_terms_1: snapshots indigenous people ways of life harvesting
subject_terms_2: Photographs Portrait photography Indigenous people Lifestyles
